content.question: Which of the following is a slope field for the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x equals, 1 minus x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows a slope field in the x y plane with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 and 2 are indicated on both the x and y axes. There are 19 rows and columns of line segments in the slope field. In each column, all the line segments have equivalent slopes. To the left of x equals negative 1, all line segments have negative slopes becoming less steep as x increases. Between x equals negative 1 and x equals zero, the line segments have positive slopes becoming steeper as x increases. Between x equals zero and x equals 1, the line segments have positive slopes becoming less steep as x increases. To the right of x equals 1, all line segments have negative slopes becoming steeper as x increases.
